private_information: I can move disks A, B, C, D
agent_1.goal: Contribute moves involving disks A-D to reach the specified target configuration without violating Tower of Hanoi rules.

private_information: I can move disks E, F, G
agent_2.goal: Stand by to move disks E-G if required while preserving rule compliance and supporting the global objective.

private_information: I can move disks H, I, J
agent_3.goal: Stand by to move disks H-J if required while preserving rule compliance and supporting the global objective.

private_information: I audit temporal and causal consistency of the plan and remove bookkeeping shortcuts such as quota tokens or post-hoc penalties.
auditor.goal: Validate that the move sequence respects single-top moves, size ordering constraints, agent permissions, and achieves the exact goal configuration.

orchestrator.goal: Coordinate agents, use the auditor’s validation, and produce a final PDDL domain and problem for the FastDownwards solver encoding the instance with agent-specific move permissions.

public_information: Three-peg Tower of Hanoi with 10 disks A (smallest) to J (largest).
Only the top disk of any peg may be moved.
No disk may be placed on top of a smaller disk.
Agent permissions: agent_1 moves A-D, agent_2 moves E-G, agent_3 moves H-J.
Initial configuration: left has A,B,C,D,E,F,G,H,I,J (top to bottom); middle empty; right empty.
Goal configuration: left has B,E,F,G,H,I,J (top to bottom); middle has C,D (top to bottom); right has A.
move_sequence: agent_1: move disk A from left to right
agent_1: move disk B from left to middle
agent_1: move disk A from right to middle
agent_1: move disk C from left to right
agent_1: move disk A from middle to left
agent_1: move disk B from middle to right
agent_1: move disk A from left to right
agent_1: move disk D from left to middle
agent_1: move disk A from right to middle
agent_1: move disk B from right to left
agent_1: move disk A from middle to left
agent_1: move disk C from right to middle
agent_1: move disk A from left to right

local_context.system_prompt: You are agent_1 and can move disks A, B, C, D; reason about legal top-only moves and size ordering without generating PDDL.
local_context.prompt: Summarize constraints affecting disks A-D and how they support the target arrangement, focusing on preserving the larger-under-smaller rule and agent permissions.

local_context.system_prompt: You are agent_2 and can move disks E, F, G; provide situational awareness without generating PDDL.
local_context.prompt: Explain when moving E-G might be necessary or should be avoided to keep E-J anchored on the left unless required, considering the global goal.

local_context.system_prompt: You are agent_3 and can move disks H, I, J; provide situational awareness without generating PDDL.
local_context.prompt: Explain why keeping H-J stationary on the left is desirable for this instance and how to avoid unnecessary disruptions.

audit.system_prompt: You are a rigorous temporal and causal consistency auditor; validate that the move list respects Tower of Hanoi rules, agent permissions, and achieves the exact goal; remove bookkeeping shortcuts such as quota tokens and post-hoc penalties; return the original list if sound or a corrected list in the same format.
audit.prompt: Audit the proposed moves {environment->move_sequence} against the initial and goal configurations and the agent permissions; if valid, return the same ordered list; if not, return a corrected ordered list using the exact format 'agent_i: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'.

synthesize_pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with PDDL and the FastDownwards solver; produce a complete PDDL domain and a PDDL problem for this exact 3-peg Tower of Hanoi instance with agent-specific move permissions; enclose the domain between <domain></domain> and the problem between <problem></problem> tags; ensure the model is solvable by FastDownwards.
synthesize_pddl.prompt: Generate a PDDL domain and problem capturing disks A-J with strict size ordering, pegs {left, middle, right}, initial and goal states from the environment, and agent-specific permissions (agent_1 moves A-D, agent_2 moves E-G, agent_3 moves H-J); optionally include the audited move list {audited_moves} as comments; target FastDownwards.
